title: Update mbedtls dependency to latest version
body: The build currently fails because rust-lld cannot find libgcc. The latest rust-mbedtls no longer depends on libgcc.

title: elf2sgx: Remove .text_no_sgx section during conversion
body:
This pull request is related to [rust-lang pull request #67084](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/67084), which places the ELF entry point in a separate section of the ELF file. This pull request removes/overwrites that section during the conversion from ELF to SGXS, because that code is not needed in the enclave. To avoid changing the relative position of other code, the section is only removed if it is at the end of a program segment. It is overwritten with NOPs otherwise.

The pull request also includes some general refactoring of the code related to Splices.

title: Bump versions of sgxs and enclave-runner

body: and make `Command` `Send`

title: Use `slice::iter` instead of `into_iter` to avoid future breakage
body:
`an_array.into_iter()` currently just works because of the autoref
feature, which then calls `<[T] as IntoIterator>::into_iter`. But
in the future, arrays will implement `IntoIterator`, too. In order
to avoid problems in the future, the call is replaced by `iter()`
which is shorter and more explicit.

A crater run showed that your crate is affected by a potential future 
change. See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/65819 for more information.

title: Quote serde
body: This PR is meant to provide `serde` support to serialize and deserialize Quote, Report, and Targetinfo structs if the (new) "serde_support" feature is enabled.

title: WIP arch change async io : synchronous impl
body:
Cleaned up code + Did some Error checking
    
    Added in debug statements (using eprintln!)
    
    TODO:
    remove the previous main_entry function and related functions
    find best way to select numer of worker threads
    find a way to make current arch work in library mode
    need to fine tune some Error handling
    1) bail! wont work (because of crossbeam scope requiring a different return type??)
    2) need to  send an error handling message to the usercall thread if "The enclave returned from the main entrypoint in violation of the specification"
    3) need to do something about populationg `cmddata.other_reasons`
    4) need to be able to read 'cmddata.primary_panic_reason'
